author: Olla Abbasi
text: 'THE BEST MIDDLE EASTERN FOOD IN NJ!♥️🙏🏼'

author: Sandy Godfrey
text: '$12.50. Just saying.'

author: Chloe Bergman-Ray
text: 'We went here for the first time recently and had a wonderful experience. The staff were so friendly and food was delicious. Plus its BYOB!'

author: John Bing
text: "Love you abraham...you have feed me for more than 25 years...amazing food never disappointed no one makes lamb like you...but I like everything you cook there...please don't retire I will starve to death....jtb"

author: Shilpa Themdeo
text: 'One of the oldest restaurant in town
column5: so it was a must try
column6: even though we were late for the dinner
column7: they served us very well. Falafel and soup were great. They have good variety of desserts.'

author: Shareen Fatima
text: 'This is a Mediterranean delight. Went there for a friend’s birthday dinner and so glad to have chosen this place. The staff is extremely accommodating and helpful. They even played the birthday song while we cut the cake (which was really nice). Everything we ordered was so refreshing from the Tabouleh salad to the falafel platter and the Sahara chicken. Highly recommend this place if you’re in the area. Super friendly on the pocket. Will definitely be back again.'

author: Tim Krasniqi
text: 'I’ve been wanting to try this place so badly and finally got the chance! Service was great! Mix Grille was juicy and tender! And please don’t leave without trying the homemade baklava. We tried the pistachioand the regular one. To die for!'

author: Lisa M Isley
text: 'We had such a nice experience here and our server could not have been kinder!! It was so refreshing. The food was absolutely delicious'

author: Fargol Araghi
text: 'Good foods there!'

author: Ellie Di Liberto
text: "Love this place! I've been going since 2017 and will never stop(: The food is so authentic and always outstanding. They have my order memorized and the service is always great."

author: Parichit choksi
text: 'Hi
column5: it was good food .'

author: Piyush
text: 'Enjoyed the hummus platter a lot. Will come back.'

author: Benedikt Parstorfer
text: 'Always delicious - one of our go-to takeout and delivery spots.'

author: Eric Rodriguez
text: "Best place to eat owner goes out of way to show case his love and passion food the food I could eat everyday it's that good"

author: Nu Fone
text: 'A wonderful experience. I used to come here as a kid and stopped coming for almost a decade but the food did not miss a step. Still delicious. Stellar service. This place has been in business for almost 40 years and once you come and eat you will understand why.'

author: Priyank Jain
text: "The taste
column5: volume and presentation of the food are all top quality. The food is on the pricier side
column6: but totally worth it. The outdoor sitting area is cute in terms if style. Definitely the best middle eastern food I've tried in Hoboken so far."

author: J. T.
text: 'Food was decent. What gave a less positive feeling was the extra charges for credit card use and obligatory service charge. Added up more than 30% to our bill'

author: reccden reccden
text: "I love Ali Baba's they always deliver!  The owner is super friendly as are the rest of the staff. Even the rice is addicting!! I'm sure it's cooked in butter or drippings.\nThe only thing I wish is that they would add more veggies to the plates rather than just one pepper and quarter of a tomato-- but this seems to be pretty typical for most  middle eastern cuisine."

author: Alejandro Herrera
text: 'The food was ok and customer service was average. Beware of the tip included on the check!!! Would have given a tip regardless
column5: but an imposed tip came off as kind of rude. Will not be going back.'

author: louai kourani
text: 'Best falafel sandwiches in town'

author: Aki
text: "(Translated by Google) To accompany playing in the park along the river. It was a weekday
column5: but the road in front of me wasn't very open
column6: so it's recommended to stop at the road on the river side. I ordered pita and beef kebab with something like vegetable croquette
column7:
which is a specialty of the shop. I was full with plenty of vegetables. The seasoning was just right and both were delicious. I regret that I should have taken on the challenge with handmade sweets lined up in the glass showcase inside the store.

(Original)
川沿いの公園遊びのお供に。平日でしたが目の前の路駐はなかなか空いておらず川側に入った道に停めるのがオススメ。お店の名物という野菜コロッケみたいのが入ったピタとビーフケバブを注文。野菜たっぷりずっしり重たく満腹になりました。味付けがちょうど良くどちらも美味しかったです。店内ガラスショーケースには手作りの甘そうなお菓子が並んでいてチャレンジすれば良かったと後悔。"

author: Kerry McNeilly
text: 'Love Ali baba! Their 40 Thieves Grill Mix our favorite thing on the menu!'

author: H A
text: "The food was Okay.\n\nTheir online ordering vendor (Beyond Menu) is nothing but terrible. I put in an order
column5: they called me and asked so many questions for verification. Once I arrived at the restaurant I was told that the order was cancelled by BeyondMenu. No heads-up
column6: no courtesy call
column7: no nothing.\n\nOrdered 40 Thieves Grill Mix (for 2) which was much less in quantity than for-2 meals I've had in do many other restaurants."

author: Abdullah Alazzani
text: 'Great food and wonderful service 👍🏻'

author: Nick Papp
text: 'the gyro is not that good'

author: Tom Zschach
text: 'Good quality Mediterranean food and friendly service with neighborhood feel.'

author: N M
text: 'I stopped by on Sunday afternoon for lunch and these guys were amazing! They were friendly
column5: professional and the food was amazing! As a middle eastern person having middle eastern food from my parenrs I tend to be a bigger critic but loved their food! Highly recommend!!  Portions and price is just right. Plus they took COVID precautions very seriously
column6: which I appreciated. Thanks for a great meal!'

author: Hector Hernandez
text: 'Super fast pickup
column5: very friendly service and most importantly
column6: delicious food'

author: K L
text: 'Not sure why I haven’t ordered from here previously
column5: but that’s my loss. Haven’t eaten inside yet
column6: but have gotten delivery. Delivery is quick
column7: food is still warm
column8: and everything I’ve tried so far is delicious - chicken tikka
column12: pita. Can’t wait to order again and try some other dishes!'

author: Syed Arif
text: "AMAZING AMAZING FOOD!!! The owner is super friendly and really knows what he's doing! Try the sandwiches!"

author: Adina Riback
text: 'Just ordered the moussaka! AND OMG! It is delicious!!! So many flavors that go well together. I’ve been looking for good moussaka in the area and so glad I found one!! Can’t wait to try all the other food they have!'

author: BioTerraSolutions Rick Eustaquio
text: 'Good'

author: Sarwat Hasan
text: 'Good service and good place but its expensive'

author: Tony Kinyua
text: 'Great Halal food and excellent service'

author: Enrique Prado
text: "Let me tell you if you are looking for fresh delicious and great ambience for turkish food this is a excelent place
column5: we went for dinner and order the main dishes the  40's . We will come back for more!!!"

author: Cihan Aygunes
text: 'First of all
column5: it’s not a Turkish restaurant. The food is not fresh. We ordered kids menu for my 4 year old and chicken came burned. We felt the same burnt smell in chicken sandwich. We ordered mousaka and it was clear that it cooked days ago. Friendly staff. Hummus is complementary.'

author: Yahya ibn Waqar
text: 'The best food. I love it❤️ And also Great customer service.'

author: L Frees
text: 'The best chicken soup!!! Ibrahim makes everything with love and you can taste it!! If I am starting to feel sick I always have the chicken soup and start feeling better!! It’s a beautiful culinary fusion healthy and comfort!!! It’s a must try!!'

author: Arash Amini
text: "The service was overall good. But sahara chicken was dry and felfels were greasy. The skirt steak was not seasoned. The only good point about food is that it's halal."

author: Hiro Mishima Reed
text: 'The best middle eastern food I’ve ever had in my life! I’ll definitely come again!'

author: Julie B
text: 'The food here is delicious
column5: my fave is the Chicken Tikka sandwich. My husband loves the tandoori. The falalfel is also great. Yummy pickles on the sandwiches. We got the mixed grill platter to split and every tasted so good. Love love love this place.'

author: Vinny Vaducci
text: 'This is one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. The food is extraordinary and the service is fabulous. The outdoor seating has a beautiful view of the hi rise towers in NYC
column5: everything is amazing.'

author: Rajaddin Abdelaziz
text: 'Mashallah this is one of the best
column5: if not the best Middle Eastern Restaurants within a 300 mile radius. The food is very fresh and the portions are enormous for a fraction of the cost from other restaurants. The atmosphere & especially the service are outstanding.'

author: suchendra kuchipudi
text: 'Lamb chops are on the expensive side but food is good'

author: Cassie Allison
text: 'My preferred spot for delicious middle eastern food. Food was so tasty. I had a cousin come into town and asked me to take him back here. Prices were decent.'

author: Emily Barker
text: 'Ali Baba is the absolute best! Everything from their hummus to honey cake is delicious and authentic
column5: they give you a lot of food for a good price (especially the 40 thieves plate!)
column6: and they are super nice
column7: friendly people who you can feel great about supporting.'

author: Guada Millet
text: 'Amazing food and friendly staff! The Forty Thieves Grill Mix was plenty of food for me and my husband
column5: so it’s really good value. The meats are perfectly-seasoned and so juicy. The honey cake is also delicious. We will be coming back!'

author: Awaad Aamir
text: 'Seriously
column5: one of the nicest restaurant owners I’ve met. Sat me and my girlfriend down and told us about his worldly adventures. Food was also top notch
column6: it’s definitely an experience and the staff brings a lot of authenticity to the place.'

author: Haneef Arbubakrr
text: 'Great food
column5: seasoned perfectly
column6: great portions
column7: clean location and really good service. Highly recommend and I will be returning with my family/friends.'

author: Katherine Shelton
text: 'Fantastic! Abraham
column5: the owner
column6:
is so friendly!

I stopped in to pick up the Hareesa-Honey Cake. Ironically I have only found this dessert on the west coast at a resultant with the same name!

Will be back as soon as possible.'

author: Gun For Hire Range
text: 'This place has been around 38 years and it’s no accident. Abe the owner is a perfectionist and the food is always excellent. His staff is very attentive and professional. If you live middle eastern food look no further. I have never had better falafel
column5: ever. Make sure you save room for dessert.'

author: habib ahmad
text: 'I was honestly shocked by how amazing their food is. To keep it short and simple very Authentic middle eastern food and you can taste the culture in it! By far best falafel I’ve had!'

author: Wissam Hamou
text: "I was just blown away by this place. The staff was extremely nice
column5: helpful
column6: and answered all our questions. The food came out very quick
column7: from the hummus
column11: gyro etc... My friends and I had a royal feast! It is just mind-blowing how good the meat
column12: vegetables and the overall dishes were. Let me finish this review saying that the mint lemonade was the best I had in my life
column14: not too sour. Just very well balanced. If you're in the area and hungry
column15: you have to come to this place."

author: Licia McClary
text: "Hands down the best Middle Eastern restaurant in all of Hudson or Bergen counties.  We ordered delivery for the first time last week
column5: during normal times we would usually just drop in or pick up.  They have been here since the 80's and that is because they make wonderful food and have really nice people working here.  We live exactly 2 miles from them and when I asked if they would deliver the owner said absolutely!  I prefer to order direct when I want a delivery versus any of those delivery places.  The food came hot and quick! We ordered a lot of food
column6: enough for 4 or 5 and we are only 2 but we wanted leftovers and we are really happy we did.  Everything was cooked perfectly
column7: juicy chicken
column9: lamb kabobs were tender and full of flavor and lamb chops
column10: my hunny's favorite.  He said they were to die for!  He didn't share them with me but he already said we need to order again soon and I want those lamb chops!  The 40 Theives dinner for 2 people is the perfect way to have a taste across the board of what they have.  You get beef gyro
column15: seasonsed rice  and a white garlic sauce very similar to a tzatziki just milder.  Their meats were terrific and the baba gannoush was nice and smokey while the hummus was simply spot on!  Have to order a side order of that next time to have more :)  Also ordered Lamb chops
column16: as I said before my hunny LOVED THEM.  He has brought them up several times the last few days.  Even though we had chicken in the 40 thieves
column17: we also ordered chicken tandoori this was really tender and nicely seasoned.  Not spicy at all
column18: but I asked the gentleman on the phone which was his favorite chicken dish and he said this so we tried it
column20: next we will go for the spicy and try Chicken tika.  We tried grape leaves
column21: spheeha and spinach pie app's.  All very tasty and good.   Overall
column24: packed well and arrived hot.  Cannot wait to go there and sit down and just have them bring us platters of food!  If you want something different for take out this is the place.  Love to support the local businesses and hey after 35+ years they definitely know what they are doing."

author: Emily Osofsky
text: 'Food was outstanding.'

author: Linda Diaz-Murphy
text: 'fabulous take out'

author: Allyson Clark
text: "Ali Baba is the best restaurant in hoboken!! Amazing prices and incredible food. The owners are extremely nice and hard working. I've never been to any other restaurant where I get better quality for the price. 11/10 highly recommend!!"

author: IMTIAZ AHMED SIDDIQUEE
text: "Staff's are very nice but foods are plain trash for what they cost."

author: Fahad Khan
text: 'Loved it. Lamb kabab sandwich is a must try'

author: Ali Siddiqui
text: "It's just Okay
column5: nothing exceptionally good."

author: Sunil Dalal
text: 'FRIENDLY QUICK SERVICE.\nNICE AND CLEAN PLACE..FEEL LIKE THE FAMILY MEMBERS WITH OWNER ABBAS.'

author: Yasser Ahmed
text: 'Delicious food'

author: Abadi
text: 'VERY EXPENSIVE!!!!!! PLUS THEY GIVE VERY LITTLE'

author: Onur
text: 'Mezes were good but Entrees were just ok.'

author: Vanessa Gonzalez
text: 'My boyfriend and I just went here for lunch and it was AMAZING! Not only is the food great
column5: but so is the customer service!! If you’re thinking about it just do it! You won’t regret it'

author: You Ra
text: 'Fresh food. Hummus was tasty as was the grilled food. The decor was cool.\nWould go again.'

author: Nick LaMendola
text: 'The falafel and grape leaves were great. On my short list of places I have to go to when visiting Hoboken.'

author: Amr Dagher
text: 'Great restaurant
column5: Ahmed and Vanessa are lovely
column6: friendly.  Highly recommend their food. This place is a new favorite for me.'

author: Tanya Riley
text: "My husband and I got the Forty Thieves. It's a mix of chicken
column5: lamb
column6: kefta and beef gyro. All of which was amazing. The hummus was perfect. Ahmed and Vanessa took very good care of us.  Highly recommend the pistachio baklava. This place is a new favorite for us."

author: Zahed Patwary
text: 'My family and I had an amazing experience at Ali Baba. The owner treat you like a family member. He was such a Kind person
column5: as I went inside of his restaurant with my new born baby he moved his SUV from front of the store so I can park there. The restaurant is super clean.  I highly recommend the Lamb Chops ✅ .'

author: Christopher Landes
text: 'Great food
column5: great service and fun to try new dishes...'

author: Ajay Kumar
text: 'Wonderful place.\nWide variety of choices for vegetarian diners\nMy favorite is Turkish coffee'

author: alexei lifa
text: 'We took meat plate
column5: all the meats were supper tender
column6: and a Sheff came to say hello .\nSalads and hummus super fresh'

author: Seth Kirschner
text: 'The food is outstanding. Ibrahim and the staff are incredible and friendly.\nI love this restaurant so much I could eat there for both lunch and dinner (and I have). This is one of the best places in Hoboken for some authentic and delicious food. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!'

author: FATMA EROGLU
text: "I have a lot to say about this restaurant but in short just don't go there.\n\nFirst of all
column5: it is not a Turkish restaurant. It is Arabic kitchen! Secondly
column6: food is terrible. Do NOT trust the images. They’re totally fake! It is awful. I ordered one of the dishes and got only bite and returned it and i paid $30 for it.\n\nStill everything is fine. I mean
column7: food can be terrible but the staff is worse than the food too!\nWaitress tried charged me %18 tip for such an awful food. I went to Ali Baba for four people and paid $153 with the highest tip without asking me. I told them the tip is too much. Then I paid without the tip. So
column8: for few days I found out that Alibaba charged me twice! First for $153 and $139. I called them for such a terrible mistake and they told me that they can not cancel the transaction which I am sure that all restaurants are able to do that. So
column9: i called my bank to cancel transaction. After waiting to hear from the bank
column10: Alibaba called me for their mistake and they told me that I should come to the restaurant. I went there and they told me that they can transfer the money to my credit card. Now
column11:
I find out that they charged me again for $149.

I just wanted to have a good time in that restaurant and I’ve been regretting for weeks.
PLEASE DON’T GO THERE!"

author: silvio garola
text: 'If you like Asian food'

author: Dhatrish Rajdev
text: "Trying to think of what's NOT good there and nothing comes to mind. If you like smokey
column5: charry flavors
column6: you get a ton of it and you don't have to order meat for it - try  their Babaganoush. On the other hand
column7: chicken tandoor sandwich
column9: kebabs are all exquisite and so is their flavorful and aromatic basmati rice."

author: Morris Goldberg
text: 'Great Service and food
column5: .... the staff is awesome the owner is always there and very friendly !'

author: Ahmad Abbasi
text: 'Delicious middle eastern food: Humus
column5: Falafel
column6: Baba Ghanoche
column7: & Tabouleh and those were the appetizer course!\n\nGrilled Rib Eye steak smothered with onions & mushrooms& garnished with thin slices of zucchini and red onions: yum!'

author: E Gill
text: 'I can’t speak for much of the menu because I don’t eat meat
column5: but all of the vegetarian options are exceptional. The owner is usually there and he’s a really nice guy. However
column6: I felt a little scammed by the fact that they automatically bring you a bottle of water without asking and then charge you for it.'

author: Priya Gautam
text: 'Great food'

author: ISO Media
text: 'They put their own tip and service fees without asking. Food was cold and serving size wasn’t that big.'

author: Joshua Tedesco
text: 'The food is amazing. Lamb was perfectly cooked. Fantastic vegetarian platters. The rice was incredibly seasoned. 10/10 will come again.'

author: Prasad Iyer
text: 'The ambiance of the restaurant is average and as I entered i did not expect much. I ordered an vegeterian couscous. Surprisingly it was the best middle eastern dish I have ever had. It comes with a blvegetablensoup and couscous. It tasted very good and thanks to the server who helped me out to pick the dish. Also we ordered the pistachio baklava which also tasted awesome. Worth trying if you are in the neighborhood.'

author: Adam Davenport
text: 'Fantastic! Excellent food and very nice staff. The mousaka was phenomenal.'

author: Kristina Bodnya
text: 'I was confirmed that I could have a falafel without jalapeño
column5: but it tasted spicy. Grilled chicken was a little raw. Instead of a regular glass of water before meal
column6: they served us bottled water. Although
column7: I’m not even sure if we had to pay for it (I assume we did)
column8: because our check didn’t have any information about the order
column9: just the amount we had to pay 🤷🏼\u200d♀️'

author: Shahzore Qureshi
text: 'The Arab Spring dish was AMAZING. Also
column5: the head chef came out and asked if I wanted more for free! Insane.'

author: amruta shinde
text: 'The chicken kebabs are a must try!'

author: Mark Maka
text: 'Wanted to try something new so went too this place a week ago and I most say hospitality amazing
column5: delicious food
column6: just ordered for delivery
column7: they got here pretty fast
column8: food was still nice and hot
column10: this restaurant is definitely in my top 5

author: sepeedeh shahabadi
text: 'Came here for the first time today with my husband. Absolutely AMAZING food and SPECTACULAR service! I could not be happier with our experience. Highly recommend the steak!'

author: Mahmoud Darwish
text: 'Great dishes
column5: the chicken
column6: kabab and gyro are great
column7: the baklava is very delicious'

author: Asif Alam
text: 'If you are looking for a good middle eastern food
column5: this is good place to get some tasty good. I usually go with their combo platter - also like there hot chicken wings!'

author: Geraldine Smith
text: 'Food was great. Amazing coffee as well.'

author: wael isaac
text: 'Best food ever'

author: María del Mar Paulino Franco
text: 'Great and tasty food
column5: I ordered the moussaka and was delicious. I recommend this place 100%. The owner was very nice and give us to try the pistachio baklava yummyyyy'

author: divya suryanarayanan
text: 'Yummy food with good options! Ordered Veg combo platter and lamb chops. Everything tasted delicious!!\nThe owner is a very sweet man who ensures every customer leaves happy and satisfied with the food!'

author: Chris Frie
text: 'Always delicious. Love the Tika platter'

author: carter kingsley
text: 'sandwiches are top notch and the best baklava!'

author: Audria Russell
text: 'My falafel was awesomely delicious!'

author: Kelly Fetchina
text: 'Very nice atmosphere and owners were delightful
column5: Service was great and the food was excellent! 😊👍👍'

author: Rachel Colameco
text: 'Delicious
column5: authentic middle eastern cuisine. Ibrahim is delightful to talk to and he is truly passionate about serving high quality food. Highly recommend! You won’t be disappointed!'

author: Dave Curran
text: 'Good vibe
column5: perfectly cooked food and the owner treats you like family. My medium rare lamb kabob was delicious. The rice was perfect'

author: Cristina Louise
text: 'Awesome. Nice people. Food was fabulous.'

author: Thomas Petillo
text: 'Came here for Sunday lunch and the food was fantastic. Authentic
column5: fresh
column6: and perfect portion sizes. Ibrahim was gracious and down to earth. Look forward to going back often.'

author: Anoosheh Tavakoli
text: 'Delicious food
column5: Friendly owner!\nStrongly recommend it!'

author: Furniture City
text: 'Great food & superb service! 10 stars!'

author: Ammar Albayati
text: 'Good'

author: Bhavitha Dasaram
text: 'Delicious food and very good service.'

author: Victor Manuel Gonzalez
text: 'Exelents place
column5: good service
column6: good food'

author: John Collins
text: 'Tandoori chicken was cooked perfectly
column5: quick service
column6: meal was great'

author: Rajil Jain
text: 'Awesome place 👌\nDelicious food
column5: indulging atmosphere and extremely affordable price.'

author: Kush Patel
text: 'Chicken Tikka Sandwich was all right. The sandwich came apart easily. but the Falafel were delicious! Highly recommend.'

author: Mohammed Azeem
text: "Good food
column5: good environment
column6: out standing experience... what more can you ask for? We had dinner for 5 last night
column7: it was like 10 degrees outside. I went in to ask where the best place to park was and Brother Ibrahim literally stopped what he was doing and pulled out his car in front of the restaurant and let me park in his spot. The food was a reflection of this type of behavior. We ordered 2 40theives which was more than delicious and was more than enough for all of us. Matta fact i had that for lunch today. And i don't even write google reviews. Ali Baba in Hoboken gives you that authentic middleastern feel that would only rival the mideastern resturants of Paterson. Go there if you want good food and a good time."

author: David M
text: 'This is definitely an amazing place! We came here with a group of 12 people to celebrate a birthday and let me tell you
column5: it was fantastic! We all had something different and everything was perfect. Highly recommend the 40 thieves! We will definitely be returning!'

author: Florida Lover
text: 'Nice food
column5: but no napkins on the tables'

author: Stephen Lagano
text: 'Consistently good s always.  Owner is awesome'

author: M. ABBASI
text: 'The best falafel outside of the middle east...\nI’ve been visiting this place for over30 years
column5: and it never ceases to amaze me how delicious the food is.\nWe recently catered a party for 60 people
column6: we ordered the Chicken Kabab
column7: Kufta Kabab
column8: and beef Kabab. Everyone enjoyed the food... it was delivered piping hot

author: Brian Tice
text: 'Everything is great but the falafel sandwich is absolutely amazing.  Fast and friendly staff.'

author: Puja Sakhuja
text: 'Food was excellent and the service was even better.  The owner Ibrahim was very courteous and customized our order based on food preferences and the portions were also very generous.'

author: Paul Aponte
text: 'Excellent food and service. Highly recommend!'

author: Zakariya Al-naabi
text: 'Best Restaurant in the United States!!!'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "I've been meaning to try Ali Baba for a while now. The first time I tried to go
column5: they were closed due to renovations. Now that they're reopen again
column6: I finally got the chance to come in one Saturday evening. A friend and I went for dinner and we decided to share the 40 Thieves Mix Grill (combination of grilled chicken
column7: lamb kabob
column11: hummus & baba ganoush). This was a lot of food (on top of the complimentary pita and hummus they serve you once you sit down). The menu said that it was good for two people but we definitely had enough to serve a third person. My favorite was the lamb and the beef
column12: especially with the yogurt sauce (?) they give you. The chicken was okay - it wasn't dry but it was just too charred for my taste. The rice came with almonds (you can opt out of it) which I thought would be weird at first
column13: but it actually ended up adding a nice texture to it.\n\nTip - it's BYOB. I think this means water too because when we asked for a glass of water
column14: they brought out some Poland Spring and then charged us for it. A little sneaky but not enough to keep me from coming back. Overall

author: Mark Pralat
text: 'Delicious food. Friendly staff.'

author: Tracey Louis
text: 'I’ve taken a picture of what’s leftover of my tandoori chicken sandwich. It was so good that I couldn’t stop to snap a picture before it was gone. Ibrahim the owner was incredibly friendly and welcoming. The hummus appetizer was great. My mom has the chicken soup and spinach pie and enjoyed it. My sister and niece had the falafel sandwich and both enjoyed. Be careful with the hot sauce.'

author: Mardie Jane
text: "Oh my goodness. Yum yum and yum! We and our friends took a couple of bottles of wine we picked up just down the street in with us.\nWe got the meal for two to share. It was a lot of food and a little of everything I. Waitress brought extra pita and tzatizki sauce (which.if you've read my reviews of Mediterranean places I'm finiky about. It was right on)   Everything was perfect. If you ask the owner makes his own hot sauce right there. If you like heat at all you have to try it!\nBeautiful family owned
column5: it will be remodeled soon with open air eating etc but don't wait. It was fantastic. Authentic Turkish/Palastinian fare. Honey cake with semolina
column6: tahini yogurt. And if we had not been completely stuffed they had fried HALLOUMI as an appetizer!\nWill definitely return if ever in Jersey again. Maybe see it after the remodel.\nBelow is the bakliva and the honey cake. The Turkish coffee is authentically made with cardamom. Just an awesome evening."

author: Derin Dölen
text: 'Best restaurant in hoboken!'

author: E L
text: 'Very friendly staff. Good homemade food. Good moroccon soup. Good  chicken. Very friendly with authentic taste. Surprisingly fast service. Very good hummus I must say. Overall wonderful experience.'

author: Gamal Elgawly
text: 'If you like to enjoy your dinner you have to come to my favorite place
column5: nice people and very good food.'

text: 'Everything is cooked in the house. The falafel was delicious and the best part they really friendly. Take ur friends with u and have a great time 🤗'

text: 'Yummiest falafel and kebobs ever!'

text: 'Great food and staff'

author: HENEEN ABDELHAMID
text: 'Great staff and food'

author: Ramsey Abdallah
text: "The New Look is phenomenal! As usual
column5: the staff is absolutely delightful and welcoming! The Hummus was outrageous
column6: perfect consistency
column7: and was not overpowered with salt. Their salads were on point and dressed properly. The Baba Ghanoush was smokey
column9: and delicious. Try the falafel they are delectable...a perfect bite to give you that crunch factor
column10: and contrasting crispy texture that is always craved. Overall
column11: an A+ experience. A must try for anyone who hasn't yet."

author: M. Abbasi
text: 'Very friendly atmosphere
column5: great crispy falafel
column6: hummus is very creamy
column7: and tasty.\nI ordered my favorite dish; the kufta platter
column8: with tabboula instead of rice.\nThe kufta was tender and full of authentic Middle Eastern taste- parsley
column9: mild spices and cooked well done to my liking.'

author: M. Abbasi
text: 'Very friendly atmosphere
column5: great crispy falafel
column6: hummus is very creamy
column7: and tasty.\nI ordered my favorite dish; the kufta platter
column8: with tabboula instead of rice.\nThe kufta was tender and full of authentic Middle Eastern taste- parsley
column9: mild spices and cooked well done to my liking.'

author: Santiago Diez Bedoya
text: 'Great service and great food!'

author: cheryl buckley
text: 'Finally got to try this place as we just moved here and it had been closed for remodel. The staff was so friendly and helpful with picking out our food. Food was excellent true Mediterranean!  We will be back for Sure!!!'

author: David Vargas
text: 'The food here is AMAZING! We went on the recommendation of a friend and were blown away by the quality of service
column5: the quality of the food
column6: and the variety offered! Best Middle Eastern food we’ve had in a very long time!  The falafel sandwich is to die for and the tahini is phenomenal! The salad is also über fresh and delicious! Can you tell by all of my exclamation marks that we think this place is the BEST?!!!! Do yourself a favor
column7: GO EAT THERE...... NOW!!'

author: Shedy Omar
text: 'Humus and Falafel is always fresh here ! If your looking for a delicious vegetarian meal and a great Middle Eastern atmosphere then this is the spot. Im there at least once a week and this place never disappoints.'

author: Mohammed Kabbani
text: 'Extraordinary food
column5: great atmosphere
column6: and exceptional service. They’re always willing to get to know you and what you like so they can build on your feedback.'

author: Steve Tarakji
text: "Coming back from the city
column5: I had a huge craving for authentic middle eastern food on my way home. I decided to do some quick research while I was sitting in traffic with my wife (she did the research). We came across Ali Baba Restaurant. Little did we know
column6: this place is a staple for the Hoboken area for the last 36years and best known for their Falafel.  We decided to pop in and give it a try. Man was it amazing. We were quickly greeted by the sweetest waitress Jackie and then by the owner Abe himself. We honestly felt like we were regulars from the moment we sat down. The place had such an authentic and warm middle eastern feel. From experience
column7: these places are hard to come by and if you do
column8: often something like the food or something doesn't quite turn out. We placed our order for Falafel
column9: Hummus and a mixed dish that consisted of chicken and beef skewers on a bed of rice with salad and a piece of Kufta. This was the most authentic
column10: delicious middle eastern food I'd ever tried... hands down. My wife and I ate until we were about to explode. The portions were so generous we literally had to take the rest of our food home. We ate it all the next day and tasted as if we just picked it up! Definitely worth the experience and I would honestly recommend checking it out. Places like these are rare and few. Take advantage while they are still around. I know I will!"

author: Q M
text: 'Absolutely delicious food! Theres nothing I wouldnt recommend
column5: but personally love the fresh fried falafel with the hummus
column6: and the shawarma sandwiches. The rice dishes are fantastic too
column7: as are the fattoush salad
column8: and desserts! Def check it out!'

author: Shahed Baker
text: 'Hands down best middle eastern spot I’ve been too in NJ. The falafal sandwich was incredibly fresh and full of flavor. Its got the perfect amount of heat and the tahina and homous was the best I’ve tasted. This is my goto for sandwiches now. Apparently theyve been in Hoboken 36 years! One of the few Hoboken gems still remaining. Great for vegans!'

author: Shiv Gulati
text: "The BEST lamb in Hoboken. I dine in often
column5: and end every meal with a Turkish tea. House made desserts
column6: delicious middle eastern cuisine
column7: amazing coffee
column8: you cannot go wrong here. Nice decor
column9: and one of Hoboken's longer established owner operated businesses."

author: Joel Lane
text: 'Great food
column5: good aie portions and staff that was certainly pleasant'

author: Matthew C
text: 'Tasty.  I got spinach pie and it is good.  Only downside is that portion is not enough for me.  (Only one slide)'

author: David Gil
text: 'Small place but with great food and surprisingly fast service. the restaurant staff was very friendly and attentive. Owner came out a couple of times to make sure our food was good.'

author: Ms. W
text: 'I was undecided for lunch and looking for something different I came here and ordered a beef gyro to go. I must say I thoroughly enjoyed this gyro. It was fresh
column5: full
column6: it had scallions
column7: red bell pepper
column8: and on top slivers of some kind of mild  pickle. What a nice touch and only $7.49 with a free beverage. I will definitely be back for that and to try their spinach pie and baklava. Also the woman who took my order was very welcoming and friendly and the decor inside is warm and decorated beautifully. Looking forward to my next meal there.'

author: Damon Salvadore
text: "Great food
column5: good service
column6: convenient location
column7: and the prices are ok considering it's in Hoboken."

author: Artëm Кazantsev
text: 'Big plates
column5: the food is authentic and delicious. Lamb kebobs are recommended. One star deduction for lamb stew
column6: which was great but had too much salt. The service was perfect.'

author: Micheal Smith
text: 'Wonderful staff
column5: great atmosphere
column6: delicious food at a good price!'

author: Mark Harada
text: 'Yummy and pleasant'

author: David Silverberg
text: 'I have eaten here easily 50 times or more in the 32 years since its opening.  Always a great meal!'

author: Lenore Jean Jones
text: 'Ali Baba is a longstanding Lebanese-American restaurant in Hoboken. They are a fixture in the neighborhood
column5: with good vegetarian and non-vegetarian choices
column6: and possibilities also for gluten-free eaters. I had my last birthday lunch there
column7: and got great service. I typically go on Sunday afternoons
column8: when they are less busy. I can recommend everything except the desserts
column9: but especially the split pea soup

author: mike yafai
text: 'I make a trip from Yonkers to New Jersey spend almost $40 tolls and gas It’s not worth it'

column5: she’s a Muslim and we made our decision to try this place based on the reviews. The service was ok
column6: but the food was very disappointing!'

text: 'Best middle eastern around!'

text: 'Horrible food! HORRIBLE! My husband and I are wondering how such a restaurant can even make it in Hoboken. I chose to order and not trust the bad reviews! They are real - food is simply very low quality. Do not go!'

text: 'Boss of the middle eastern food uptown! Friendly staff. Delicious soup and cous cous.'

text: "Horrible food horrible service miserable waitress   And waiter Kabob was  smell bad look like it was very old   i was sick that night and next Day on top of everything they add 18% tip Anything we ask they did not have  it go eat McDonald's Its better then there by the way thats not  Turkish restaurant  Turkish food it's way better than that ."

text: "Staff treats you like family; you get authentic cuisine that always aims to please; everything is made fresh and priced well. If you're craving a gyro
